utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So what brings you in here to the ER?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Well, I thought I should start by saying I was recently hospitalised for pneumonia. I left five days ago, but as soon as I left that evening, I started coughing again and now I have all the same symptoms. I have a cough, I'm feeling short of breath and I have a feeling like I have a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and before you were discharged the day, can you let me know what you had and what kind of things were you treated with?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was treated with some antibiotics, I don't know exactly which ones. They said I had some sort of bacterial pneumonia.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. But then it got resolved and they sent you home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that's right.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So are your symptoms similar to when you got admitted?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: They are similar, but I feel like they are also worse now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, worse, OK, so you're having a cough, shortness of breath and fever, and did that all start together? Or did one come before another?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, so the cough came first, then the shortness of breath, and then the fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and the cough, how would you describe the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, it's harsh, it's persistent.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Are you producing any sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I guess a little bit, yeah. Yeah, I guess a little bit and it's yellow.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's yellow, OK, do you notice any kind of blood in your sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so just yellow sputum and how much would you say you're producing an average day?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, maybe like, 10 to 15 times in a day I produce enough to fill like the inside of my palm.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And with the fever, did you get a chance to measure, take a temperature at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm, no, I haven't actually taken my temperature.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, but you've been having chills and are you having any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, chills. I've been feeling kind of hot during the day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, OK. And how about the shortness of breath, is that just during activity or you can have that when you're sleeping or resting as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The shortness of breath is more with like activity when I'm walking around.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have all these symptoms been getting worse at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I'd say they're getting worse now. It's like this everyday and it's definitely getting worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you feel dizzy or lightheaded at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have any muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, a little bit.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and where on your muscles would you say are aching?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say my lower limbs and just generally all over, but just yeah like the big muscles like my thighs, my shoulders.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And have you been having any kind of swelling in your limbs at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no swelling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and any kind of swelling of your neck region or lymph nodes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I noticed.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you feel any kind of chest pain with shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and since you've been out of the hospital, have you been in contact with anyone who's sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I went straight home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And any recent travel?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no recent travel.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any kind of fatigue or increased tiredness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I feel fatigued, yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you feel at all that your heart is racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you have any symptoms like a loss of taste, sense of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: So, OK, any kind of bowel movement issues? Any constipation or diarrhea?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And any urinary trouble?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you lost any weight recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you been able to sleep throughout the night or does the cough  wake you up or the chills wake you up?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no,  they don't wake me up. I wouldn't say that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are you having any other symptoms like a sore throat, runny nose, congestion, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and anything in your house like dust or an old carpet or pets? Anything that triggers some of these symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, and in terms of your past medical history, any conditions that you've been diagnosed with like asthma, COPD, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you take any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I do, I take some multivitamins particularly calcium and vitamin D, and I'm also on Synthroid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so do you have hyperthyroidism?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, sorry I forgot to mention that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No worries. Then when you went home and you were discharged, did they give you any antibiotics to finish at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah yes, they did. So I only had one days worth left. I was switched from IV antibiotic  to the oral kind and so I'd finish the remaining pills that day, then went home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you finished the course, OK. Great and do you have any past history when you were admitted, any other hospitalizations or surgeries at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you have any family history of asthma, COPD or any lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any other conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And currently, where do you live?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live in a house with my daughter and her husband.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any one of them have similar symptoms or have been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and have you had a COVID test done at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, no COVID tests have been done. I had one in the hospital before I was admitted, but none today.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And do you smoke at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I used to smoke. I don't smoke anymore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did you quit?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: About seven years ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK congratulations.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how much would you say you smoked before that, and for how many years?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Before that, I would say it's like gosh, 20 years and then about a pack a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I drink like a glass of wine a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any other recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Yeah, so is there anything else? Any other questions that you have for me today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, what do you think I have?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so there's definitely multiple things that can be going on. Since you were just recently admitted, maybe you might have another bacterial r espiratory infection, like a pneumonia or it could be viral as well. So the first thing we want to do is for sure get COVID swab done and then we will also get, since you were admitted, as well recently, we want to get an X Ray on you just to see if there's any pneumonia. OK, and so we'll be keeping you here for a bit until everything comes back. We'll get some blood work done for you as well to see if there's any infection in your body. And then yeah, so just sit tight, we'll get all those things done. Is that OK with you?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that's great. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: You're welcome, yeah. So well will be updating you shortly.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
